decks.notes: The deck revolves around using Cloud, Midgar Mercenary as the commander to lead an aggressive playstyle, focused on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of creatures and equipment. The main strategy involves deploying creatures like Jacked Rabbit and Hunted Witness to establish board presence, while using powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Feast and Famine to enhance their abilities. In addition, the deck includes disruption elements like Drannith Magistrate and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also features a strong mana base with cards like City of Traitors and Gemstone Caverns to ensure consistent mana production. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and apply constant pressure on the opponent to secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent by utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce their life total. The commander, Kellan, Planar Trailblazer, supports this strategy by providing a consistent source of damage and recursion for key cards. The deck includes a mixture of cheap, efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Zurgo Bellstriker, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Searing Blaze to control the board and clear a path for attacks. By maintaining a fast-paced, proactive game plan, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory before they can stabilize or mount a defense.

Magda, the Hoardmaster focuses on aggressive gameplay, utilizing a variety of burn spells and creatures to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The deck includes a mix of direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning, along with creatures like Bomat Courier and Seasoned Pyromancer to pressure the opponent. With cards like Magda's ability to create treasures and artifacts like Urza's Bauble to draw extra cards, the deck aims to maintain a steady stream of threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Blood Moon and Relic of Progenitus. Overall, the strategy revolves around applying constant pressure and overwhelming the opponent with a mix of burn and creature aggression.

This aggressive partner BRG deck focuses on fast mana acceleration, efficient card draw, and powerful disruption spells to overwhelm opponents quickly. By utilizing Rograkh and Ikra Shidiqi as commanders, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game. The deck includes a mix of tutors, ritual spells, hand disruption, and removal to ensure consistency and versatility in different matchups. The inclusion of cards like Tendrils of Agony, Pyroblast, and Yawgmoth's Will showcases the deck's ability to generate explosive plays and close out games swiftly. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around proactive plays and efficient resource management to outpace opponents and secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Aragorn, King of Gondor, as the commander to lead an aggressive strategy in a Duel Commander format. The deck includes powerful spells and creatures to apply pressure on the opponent, utilizing cards like True-Name Nemesis, Swords to Plowshares, Lightning Bolt, and Force of Negation to control the board and protect your own threats. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the aggressive game plan, with fetch lands and dual lands providing consistency and flexibility. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Counterspell and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's game plan and allow you to maintain your aggressive stance.

The deck is focused on utilizing control spells and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating incremental advantage. The goal is to keep the opponent on their back foot by countering their spells, bouncing their threats, and digging through the deck for key pieces. Lier, Disciple of the Drowned serves as the commander, providing recursion for important spells and enabling the deck's game plan. By maintaining tempo and card advantage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of disruptive plays while setting up a win condition. With a focus on efficiency and synergy, the deck aims to outmaneuver and outvalue the opponent in a one-on-one format.

This deck revolves around using Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd as a commander to build a strong board presence and apply pressure on the opponent in a Duel Commander 1 vs 1 format. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures and versatile spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It focuses on aggro tactics, utilizing cards like Palace Jailer, Swords to Plowshares, Skyclave Apparition, and Elite Spellbinder to deal with threats and maintain board advantage. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Containment Priest, Drannith Magistrate, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down the opponent's game plan. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful Aggro creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Lord of Change to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes powerful reanimation spells like Animate Dead and Exhume to bring back key creatures from the graveyard. It contains a variety of disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful tutors like Demonic Tutor and Profane Tutor to search for key pieces. The mana base is optimized with fetch lands like Polluted Delta and Verdant Catacombs to ensure consistent color fixing. The overall strategy is to apply early pressure with aggressive creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan to secure a quick victory.
